revised_title: Direct Measurement of the pH Microclimate in Rat Proximal Jejunum
tldr: Researchers directly measured the pH microclimate in the rat proximal jejunum using pH-microelectrodes. They found a pH of 6.0 in the microclimate, which could explain discrepancies in drug penetration rates. The study also questioned the existence of a microclimate and discussed its significance to malabsorption.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Gastrointestinal Physiology
